sp_option_userdel_confirm1_body_nalink_v11	If your Pokémon HOME account is linked to a Nintendo Account, they will become unlinked. As such, you will not be able to log in to or play the Nintendo Switch version of Pokémon HOME. You will also no longer be able to sync Pokémon HOME through your Nintendo Account. Please note that deleting your Pokémon HOME account will not have any effect on your linked Nintendo Account.
sp_option_userdel_confirm1_body_nalink_v12	If your Pokémon HOME account is linked to a Nintendo Account, they will become unlinked. As such, you will not be able to log in to or play the Nintendo Switch version of Pokémon HOME. You will also no longer be able to sync Pokémon HOME through your Nintendo Account. Please note that deleting your Pokémon HOME account will not have any effect on your linked Nintendo Account.  Note: If you start using Pokémon HOME anew with the same Nintendo Account, some data from your current account—such as what Mystery Gifts you've received—will carry over.
sp_option_userdel_confirm2_body_v11	If you have a Premium Plan subscription, deleting your Pokémon HOME account will not automatically cancel it. How you cancel your subscription varies depending on what version of Pokémon HOME you first registered on.  Players who subscribed through the Nintendo Switch version must cancel their subscription via Nintendo eShop.  Players who subscribed through the iOS version must cancel their subscription via the App Store.  Players who subscribed through the Android version must cancel their subscription via the Google Play Store.  Please note that we will not be issuing refunds for charges that result from forgetting to cancel your Premium Plan, nor will we be able to respond to inquiries related to this matter.
sp_option_userdel_confirm3_title_v11	Final Confirmation
sp_option_userdel_confirm3_body_v11	A deleted account cannot be recovered. All of the progress you've made in the application—such as Challenges and Pokédex entries—will be permanently lost.  Are you sure you want to delete your account?

Text File : tokuseiinfo_LA_usa.msbt
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

Text File : tokuseiinfo_SWSH_usa.msbt

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Text File : wazainfo_SWSH_usa.msbt
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
WAZAINFO_SWSH_000	———
WAZAINFO_SWSH_001	The target is physically pounded with a long tail, a foreleg, or the like.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_002	This move can't be used. It's recommended that this move is forgotten. Once forgotten, this move can't be remembered.

WAZAINFO_SWSH_005	The target is slugged by a punch thrown with muscle-packed power.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_006	Numerous coins are hurled at the target to inflict damage. Money is earned after the battle.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_007	The target is punched with a fiery fist. This may also leave the target with a burn.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_008	The target is punched with an icy fist. This may also leave the target frozen.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_009	The target is punched with an electrified fist. This may also leave the target with paralysis.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_010	Hard, pointed, sharp claws rake the target to inflict damage.

WAZAINFO_SWSH_743	This move enables the user to protect itself from all attacks. Its chance of failing rises if it is used in succession.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_744	The user unleashes a strong beam from its core. This move deals twice the damage if the target is Dynamaxed.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_745	The user ignores the effects of opposing Pokémon's moves and Abilities that draw in moves, allowing this move to hit the chosen target.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_746	This move prevents the user and the target from switching out until either of them faints. The effect goes away if either of the Pokémon leaves the field.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_747	The user eats its held Berry, then sharply raises its Defense stat.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_748	This move raises all the user's stats but prevents the user from switching out or fleeing.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_749	The user pours sticky tar over the target, lowering the target's Speed stat. The target becomes weaker to Fire-type moves.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_750	The user scatters a cloud of magic powder that changes the target to Psychic type.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_751	The user attacks twice using Dreepy. If there are two targets, this move hits each target once.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_752	The user has teatime with all the Pokémon in the battle. Each Pokémon eats its held Berry.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_753	The user locks the target in and prevents it from fleeing. This move also lowers the target's Defense and Sp. Def every turn.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_754	The user stabs the target with its electrified beak. If the user attacks before the target, the power of this move is doubled.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_755	The user rends the target with its hard gills. If the user attacks before the target, the power of this move is doubled.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_756	With its mysterious power, the user swaps the effects on either side of the field.

WAZAINFO_SWSH_758	This is a Bug-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. This lowers the target's Sp. Atk stat.

WAZAINFO_SWSH_771	This is a Ground-type attack Dynamax Pokémon use. This raises ally Pokémon's Sp. Def stats.

WAZAINFO_SWSH_781	The user becomes a gigantic sword and cuts the target. This move deals twice the damage if the target is Dynamaxed.

WAZAINFO_SWSH_783	Morpeko attacks and raises its Speed with the energy stored in its cheeks. This move's type changes depending on the user's form.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_784	The user swings its tough tail wildly and attacks opposing Pokémon. This also lowers their Attack stats.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_785	The user attacks the target by poking it with a sharply pointed branch.

WAZAINFO_SWSH_796	The user fires a beam of steel that it collected from its entire body. This also damages the user.

WAZAINFO_SWSH_798	The user attacks while destroying the terrain. This move fails when the ground hasn't turned into a terrain.

WAZAINFO_SWSH_800	In this two-turn attack, the user gathers space power and boosts its Sp. Atk stat, then attacks the target on the next turn.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_801	This move inflicts physical or special damage, whichever will be more effective. This may also poison the target.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_802	The user attacks everything around it and faints upon using this move. This move's power is increased on Misty Terrain.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_803	Gliding on the ground, the user attacks the target. This move always goes first on Grassy Terrain.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_804	The user attacks with electric voltage rising from the ground. This move's power doubles when the target is on Electric Terrain.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_805	The user utilizes the power of the terrain to attack. This move's type and power changes depending on the terrain when it's used.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_806	The user skitters behind the target to attack. This also lowers the target's Sp. Atk stat.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_807	The user attacks with energy from jealousy. This leaves all opposing Pokémon that have had their stats boosted during the turn with a burn.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_808	The user lashes out to vent its frustration toward the target. If the user's stats were lowered during this turn, the power of this move is doubled.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_809	The user attacks the target by controlling the target's item. The move fails if the target doesn't have an item.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_810	The user surrounds everything around it with highly acidic gas and melts away items they hold.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_811	The user properly coaches its ally Pokémon, boosting their Attack and Defense stats.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_812	After making its attack, the user rushes back to switch places with a party Pokémon in waiting.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_813	A consecutive three-kick attack that becomes more powerful with each successful hit.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_814	The user slams the target with its wings. The target is hit twice in a row.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_815	The user throws scorching sand at the target to attack. This may also leave the target with a burn.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_816	The user becomes one with the jungle, restoring HP and healing any status conditions of itself and its ally Pokémon in battle.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_817	The user, having mastered the Dark style, strikes the target with a fierce blow. This attack always results in a critical hit.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_818	The user, having mastered the Water style, strikes the target with a flowing motion three times in a row. This attack always results in a critical hit.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_819	The user traps the target in a cage of sparking electricity for four to five turns.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_820	Converting its life-force into power, the user attacks opposing Pokémon. The lower the user's HP, the lower the move's power.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_821	The user shoots its psychic power from its eyes to attack. This may also leave the target frozen.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_822	The user transforms its wrath into a fire-like aura to attack. This may also make opposing Pokémon flinch.

WAZAINFO_SWSH_825	The user attacks by sending a frightful amount of small ghosts at opposing Pokémon.
WAZAINFO_SWSH_826	The user attacks with its tremendous psychic power. This also removes 3 PP from the target's last move.

~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
Text File : zukan_comment_alpha_usa.msbt
~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~
ZKN_ALPHA_000_000	
ZKN_ALPHA_001_000	Bulbasaur can be seen napping in bright sunlight. There is a seed on its back. By soaking up the sun's rays, the seed grows progressively larger.
ZKN_ALPHA_002_000	There is a bud on this Pokémon's back. To support its weight, Ivysaur's legs and trunk grow thick and strong. If it starts spending more time lying in the sunlight, it's a sign that the bud will bloom into a large flower soon.
ZKN_ALPHA_003_000	There is a large flower on Venusaur's back. The flower is said to take on vivid colors if it gets plenty of nutrition and sunlight. The flower's aroma soothes the emotions of people.
ZKN_ALPHA_004_000	The flame that burns at the tip of its tail is an indication of its emotions. The flame wavers when Charmander is enjoying itself. If the Pokémon becomes enraged, the flame burns fiercely.
ZKN_ALPHA_005_000	Charmeleon mercilessly destroys its foes using its sharp claws. If it encounters a strong foe, it turns aggressive. In this excited state, the flame at the tip of its tail flares with a bluish white color.
ZKN_ALPHA_006_000	Charizard flies around the sky in search of powerful opponents. It breathes fire of such great heat that it melts anything. However, it never turns its fiery breath on any opponent weaker than itself.
ZKN_ALPHA_007_000	Squirtle's shell is not merely used for protection. The shell's rounded shape and the grooves on its surface help minimize resistance in water, enabling this Pokémon to swim at high speeds.
ZKN_ALPHA_008_000	Its tail is large and covered with a rich, thick fur. The tail becomes increasingly deeper in color as Wartortle ages. The scratches on its shell are evidence of this Pokémon's toughness as a battler.
ZKN_ALPHA_009_000	Blastoise has water spouts that protrude from its shell. The water spouts are very accurate. They can shoot bullets of water with enough accuracy to strike empty cans from a distance of over 160 feet.
ZKN_ALPHA_010_000	Caterpie has a voracious appetite. It can devour leaves bigger than its body right before your eyes. From its antenna, this Pokémon releases a terrifically strong odor.
ZKN_ALPHA_011_000	The shell covering this Pokémon's body is as hard as an iron slab. Metapod does not move very much. It stays still because it is preparing its soft innards for evolution inside the hard shell.
ZKN_ALPHA_012_000	Butterfree has a superior ability to search for delicious honey from flowers. It can even search out, extract, and carry honey from flowers that are blooming over six miles from its nest.
ZKN_ALPHA_013_000	Weedle has an extremely acute sense of smell. It is capable of distinguishing its favorite kinds of leaves from those it dislikes just by sniffing with its big red proboscis (nose).
ZKN_ALPHA_014_000	Kakuna remains virtually immobile as it clings to a tree. However, on the inside, it is extremely busy as it prepares for its coming evolution. This is evident from how hot the shell becomes to the touch.
ZKN_ALPHA_015_000	Beedrill is extremely territorial. No one should ever approach its nest—this is for their own safety. If angered, they will attack in a furious swarm.
ZKN_ALPHA_016_000	Pidgey has an extremely sharp sense of direction. It is capable of unerringly returning home to its nest, however far it may be removed from its familiar surroundings.
ZKN_ALPHA_017_000	Pidgeotto claims a large area as its own territory. This Pokémon flies around, patrolling its living space. If its territory is violated, it shows no mercy in thoroughly punishing the foe with its sharp claws.
ZKN_ALPHA_018_000	This Pokémon has a dazzling plumage of beautifully glossy feathers. Many Trainers are captivated by the striking beauty of the feathers on its head, compelling them to choose Pidgeot as their Pokémon.
ZKN_ALPHA_019_000	Rattata is cautious in the extreme. Even while it is asleep, it constantly listens by moving its ears around. It is not picky about where it lives—it will make its nest anywhere.
ZKN_ALPHA_020_000	Raticate's sturdy fangs grow steadily. To keep them ground down, it gnaws on rocks and logs. It may even chew on the walls of houses.
ZKN_ALPHA_021_000	Spearow has a very loud cry that can be heard over half a mile away. If its high, keening cry is heard echoing all around, it is a sign that they are warning each other of danger.
ZKN_ALPHA_022_000	Fearow is recognized by its long neck and elongated beak. They are conveniently shaped for catching prey in soil or water. It deftly moves its long and skinny beak to pluck prey.
ZKN_ALPHA_023_000	Ekans curls itself up in a spiral while it rests. Assuming this position allows it to quickly respond to a threat from any direction with a glare from its upraised head.
ZKN_ALPHA_024_000	This Pokémon is terrifically strong in order to constrict things with its body. It can even flatten steel oil drums. Once Arbok wraps its body around its foe, escaping its crunching embrace is impossible.
ZKN_ALPHA_025_000	This Pokémon has electricity-storing pouches on its cheeks. These appear to become electrically charged during the night while Pikachu sleeps. It occasionally discharges electricity when it is dozy after waking up.
ZKN_ALPHA_026_000	This Pokémon exudes a weak electrical charge from all over its body that makes it take on a slight glow in darkness. Raichu plants its tail in the ground to discharge electricity.
ZKN_ALPHA_027_000	Sandshrew has a very dry hide that is extremely tough. The Pokémon can roll into a ball that repels any attack. At night, it burrows into the desert sand to sleep.
ZKN_ALPHA_028_000	Sandslash can roll up its body as if it were a ball covered with large spikes. In battle, this Pokémon will try to make the foe flinch by jabbing it with its spines. It then leaps at the stunned foe to tear wildly with its sharp claws.
ZKN_ALPHA_029_000	Nidoran♀ has barbs that secrete a powerful poison. They are thought to have developed as protection for this small-bodied Pokémon. When enraged, it releases a horrible toxin from its horn.
ZKN_ALPHA_030_000	When Nidorina are with their friends or family, they keep their barbs tucked away to prevent hurting each other. This Pokémon appears to become nervous if separated from the others.
ZKN_ALPHA_031_000	Nidoqueen's body is encased in extremely hard scales. It is adept at sending foes flying with harsh tackles. This Pokémon is at its strongest when it is defending its young.
ZKN_ALPHA_032_000	Nidoran♂ has developed muscles for moving its ears. Thanks to them, the ears can be freely moved in any direction. Even the slightest sound does not escape this Pokémon's notice.
ZKN_ALPHA_033_000	Nidorino has a horn that is harder than a diamond. If it senses a hostile presence, all the barbs on its back bristle up at once, and it challenges the foe with all its might.
ZKN_ALPHA_034_000	Nidoking's thick tail packs enormously destructive power. With one swing, it can topple a metal transmission tower. Once this Pokémon goes on a rampage, there is no stopping it.
ZKN_ALPHA_035_000	On every night of a full moon, groups of this Pokémon come out to play. When dawn arrives, the tired Clefairy return to their quiet mountain retreats and go to sleep nestled up against each other.
ZKN_ALPHA_036_000	Clefable moves by skipping lightly as if it were flying using its wings. Its bouncy step lets it even walk on water. It is known to take strolls on lakes on quiet, moonlit nights.
ZKN_ALPHA_037_000	Inside Vulpix's body burns a flame that never goes out. During the daytime, when the temperatures rise, this Pokémon releases flames from its mouth to prevent its body from growing too hot.
ZKN_ALPHA_038_000	Legend has it that Ninetales came into being when nine wizards possessing sacred powers merged into one. This Pokémon is highly intelligent—it can understand human speech.
ZKN_ALPHA_039_000	When this Pokémon sings, it never pauses to breathe. If it is in a battle against an opponent that does not easily fall asleep, Jigglypuff cannot breathe, endangering its life.
ZKN_ALPHA_040_000	Wigglytuff's body is very flexible. By inhaling deeply, this Pokémon can inflate itself seemingly without end. Once inflated, Wigglytuff bounces along lightly like a balloon.
ZKN_ALPHA_041_000	Zubat avoids sunlight because exposure causes it to become unhealthy. During the daytime, it stays in caves or under the eaves of old houses, sleeping while hanging upside down.
ZKN_ALPHA_042_000	Golbat bites down on prey with its four fangs and drinks the victim's blood. It becomes active on inky dark moonless nights, flying around to attack people and Pokémon.
ZKN_ALPHA_043_000	Oddish searches for fertile, nutrient-rich soil, then plants itself. During the daytime, while it is planted, this Pokémon's feet are thought to change shape and become similar to the roots of trees.
ZKN_ALPHA_044_000	From its mouth Gloom drips honey that smells absolutely horrible. Apparently, it loves the horrid stench. It sniffs the noxious fumes and then drools even more of its honey.
ZKN_ALPHA_045_000	Vileplume has the world's largest petals. They are used to attract prey that are then doused with toxic spores. Once the prey are immobilized, this Pokémon catches and devours them.
ZKN_ALPHA_046_000	Paras has parasitic mushrooms growing on its back called tochukaso. They grow large by drawing nutrients from this Bug Pokémon host. They are highly valued as a medicine for extending life.
ZKN_ALPHA_047_000	Parasect is known to infest large trees en masse and drain nutrients from the lower trunk and roots. When an infested tree dies, they move onto another tree all at once.
ZKN_ALPHA_048_000	Venonat is said to have evolved with a coat of thin, stiff hair that covers its entire body for protection. It possesses large eyes that never fail to spot even minuscule prey.
ZKN_ALPHA_049_000	Venomoth is nocturnal—it is a Pokémon that only becomes active at night. Its favorite prey are small insects that gather around streetlights, attracted by the light in the darkness.
ZKN_ALPHA_050_000	Diglett are raised in most farms. The reason is simple— wherever this Pokémon burrows, the soil is left perfectly tilled for planting crops. This soil is made ideal for growing delicious vegetables.
ZKN_ALPHA_051_000	Dugtrio are actually triplets that emerged from one body. As a result, each triplet thinks exactly like the other two triplets. They work cooperatively to burrow endlessly.
ZKN_ALPHA_052_000	Meowth withdraws its sharp claws into its paws to slinkily sneak about without making any incriminating footsteps. For some reason, this Pokémon loves shiny coins that glitter with light.
ZKN_ALPHA_053_000	Persian has six bold whiskers that give it a look of toughness. The whiskers sense air movements to determine what is in the Pokémon's surrounding vicinity. It becomes docile if grabbed by the whiskers.
ZKN_ALPHA_054_000	If it uses its mysterious power, Psyduck can't remember having done so. It apparently can't form a memory of such an event because it goes into an altered state that is much like deep sleep.
ZKN_ALPHA_055_000	Golduck is the fastest swimmer among all Pokémon. It swims effortlessly, even in a rough, stormy sea. It sometimes rescues people from wrecked ships floundering in high seas.
ZKN_ALPHA_056_000	When Mankey starts shaking and its nasal breathing turns rough, it's a sure sign that it is becoming angry. However, because it goes into a towering rage almost instantly, it is impossible for anyone to flee its wrath.
ZKN_ALPHA_057_000	When Primeape becomes furious, its blood circulation is boosted. In turn, its muscles are made even stronger. However, it also becomes much less intelligent at the same time.
ZKN_ALPHA_058_000	Growlithe has a superb sense of smell. Once it smells anything, this Pokémon won't forget the scent, no matter what. It uses its advanced olfactory sense to determine the emotions of other living things.
ZKN_ALPHA_059_000	Arcanine is known for its high speed. It is said to be capable of running over 6,200 miles in a single day and night. The fire that blazes wildly within this Pokémon's body is its source of power.
ZKN_ALPHA_060_000	Poliwag has a very thin skin. It is possible to see the Pokémon's spiral innards right through the skin. Despite its thinness, however, the skin is also very flexible. Even sharp fangs bounce right off it.
ZKN_ALPHA_061_000	The surface of Poliwhirl's body is always wet and slick with a slimy fluid. Because of this slippery covering, it can easily slip and slide out of the clutches of any enemy in battle.
ZKN_ALPHA_062_000	Poliwrath's highly developed, brawny muscles never grow fatigued, however much it exercises. It is so tirelessly strong, this Pokémon can swim back and forth across the ocean without effort.
ZKN_ALPHA_063_000	Abra needs to sleep for eighteen hours a day. If it doesn't, this Pokémon loses its ability to use telekinetic powers. If it is attacked, Abra escapes using Teleport while it is still sleeping.
ZKN_ALPHA_064_000	Kadabra holds a silver spoon in its hand. The spoon is used to amplify the alpha waves in its brain. Without the spoon, the Pokémon is said to be limited to half the usual amount of its telekinetic powers.
ZKN_ALPHA_065_000	Alakazam's brain continually grows, infinitely multiplying brain cells. This amazing brain gives this Pokémon an astoundingly high IQ of 5,000. It has a thorough memory of everything that has occurred in the world.
ZKN_ALPHA_066_000	Machop exercises by hefting around a Graveler as if it were a barbell. There are some Machop that travel the world in a quest to master all kinds of martial arts.
ZKN_ALPHA_067_000	Machoke undertakes bodybuilding every day even as it helps people with tough, physically demanding labor. On its days off, this Pokémon heads to the fields and mountains to exercise and train.
ZKN_ALPHA_068_000	Machamp is known as the Pokémon that has mastered every kind of martial arts. If it grabs hold of the foe with its four arms, the battle is all but over. The hapless foe is thrown far over the horizon.
ZKN_ALPHA_069_000	Bellsprout's thin and flexible body lets it bend and sway to avoid any attack, however strong it may be. From its mouth, this Pokémon spits a corrosive fluid that melts even iron.
ZKN_ALPHA_070_000	Weepinbell has a large hook on its rear end. At night, the Pokémon hooks on to a tree branch and goes to sleep. If it moves around in its sleep, it may wake up to find itself on the ground.
ZKN_ALPHA_071_000	Victreebel has a long vine that extends from its head. This vine is waved and flicked about as if it were an animal to attract prey. When an unsuspecting prey draws near, this Pokémon swallows it whole.
ZKN_ALPHA_072_000	Tentacool absorbs sunlight and refracts it using water inside its body to convert it into beam energy. This Pokémon shoots beams from the small round organ above its eyes.
ZKN_ALPHA_073_000	Tentacruel has tentacles that can be freely elongated and shortened at will. It ensnares prey with its tentacles and weakens the prey by dosing it with a harsh toxin. It can catch up to 80 prey at the same time.
ZKN_ALPHA_074_000	When Geodude sleeps deeply, it buries itself halfway into the ground. It will not awaken even if hikers step on it unwittingly. In the morning, this Pokémon rolls downhill in search of food.
ZKN_ALPHA_075_000	Rocks are Graveler's favorite food. This Pokémon will climb a mountain from the base to the summit, crunchingly feasting on rocks all the while. Upon reaching the peak, it rolls back down to the bottom.
ZKN_ALPHA_076_000	Golem is known for rolling down from mountains. To prevent them from rolling into the homes of people downhill, grooves have been dug into the sides of mountains to serve as guideways for diverting this Pokémon's course.
ZKN_ALPHA_077_000	Ponyta is very weak at birth. It can barely stand up. This Pokémon becomes stronger by stumbling and falling to keep up with its parent.
ZKN_ALPHA_078_000	Rapidash usually can be seen casually cantering in the fields and plains. However, when this Pokémon turns serious, its fiery manes flare and blaze as it gallops its way up to 150 mph.
ZKN_ALPHA_079_000	Slowpoke uses its tail to catch prey by dipping it in water at the side of a river. However, this Pokémon often forgets what it's doing and often spends entire days just loafing at water's edge.
ZKN_ALPHA_080_000	Slowbro's tail has a Shellder firmly attached with a bite. As a result, the tail can't be used for fishing anymore. This causes Slowbro to grudgingly swim and catch prey instead.
ZKN_ALPHA_081_000	Magnemite floats in the air by emitting electromagnetic waves from the units at its sides. These waves block gravity. This Pokémon becomes incapable of flight if its internal electrical supply is depleted.
ZKN_ALPHA_082_000	Magneton emits a powerful magnetic force that is fatal to electronics and precision instruments. Because of this, it is said that some towns warn people to keep this Pokémon inside a Poké Ball.
ZKN_ALPHA_083_000	Farfetch'd is always seen with a stalk from a plant of some sort. Apparently, there are good stalks and bad stalks. This Pokémon has been known to fight with others over stalks.
ZKN_ALPHA_084_000	Doduo's two heads contain completely identical brains. A scientific study reported that on rare occasions, there will be examples of this Pokémon possessing different sets of brains.
ZKN_ALPHA_085_000	Apparently, the heads aren't the only parts of the body that Dodrio has three of. It has three sets of hearts and lungs as well, so it is capable of running long distances without rest.
ZKN_ALPHA_086_000	Seel hunts for prey in the frigid sea underneath sheets of ice. When it needs to breathe, it punches a hole through the ice with the sharply protruding section of its head.
ZKN_ALPHA_087_000	Dewgong loves to snooze on bitterly cold ice. The sight of this Pokémon sleeping on a glacier was mistakenly thought to be a mermaid by a mariner long ago.
ZKN_ALPHA_088_000	Grimer emerged from the sludge that settled on a polluted seabed. This Pokémon loves anything filthy. It constantly leaks a horribly germ-infested fluid from all over its body.
ZKN_ALPHA_089_000	This Pokémon's favorite food is anything that is repugnantly filthy. In dirty towns where people think nothing of throwing away litter on the streets, Muk are certain to gather.
ZKN_ALPHA_090_000	At night, this Pokémon uses its broad tongue to burrow a hole in the seafloor sand and then sleep in it. While it is sleeping, Shellder closes its shell, but leaves its tongue hanging out.
ZKN_ALPHA_091_000	Cloyster is capable of swimming in the sea. It does so by swallowing water, then jetting it out toward the rear. This Pokémon shoots spikes from its shell using the same system.
ZKN_ALPHA_092_000	Gastly is largely composed of gaseous matter. When exposed to a strong wind, the gaseous body quickly dwindles away. Groups of this Pokémon cluster under the eaves of houses to escape the ravages of wind.
ZKN_ALPHA_093_000	Haunter is a dangerous Pokémon. If one beckons you while floating in darkness, you must never approach it. This Pokémon will try to lick you with its tongue and steal your life away.
ZKN_ALPHA_094_000	Sometimes, on a dark night, your shadow thrown by a streetlight will suddenly and startlingly overtake you. It is actually a Gengar running past you, pretending to be your shadow.
ZKN_ALPHA_095_000	Onix has a magnet in its brain. It acts as a compass so that this Pokémon does not lose direction while it is tunneling. As it grows older, its body becomes increasingly rounder and smoother.
ZKN_ALPHA_096_000	If your nose becomes itchy while you are sleeping, it's a sure sign that one of these Pokémon is standing above your pillow and trying to eat your dream through your nostrils.
ZKN_ALPHA_097_000	Hypno holds a pendulum in its hand. The arcing movement and glitter of the pendulum lull the foe into a deep state of hypnosis. While this Pokémon searches for prey, it polishes the pendulum.

ZKN_ALPHA_100_000	Voltorb is extremely sensitive—it explodes at the slightest of shocks. It is rumored that it was first created when a Poké Ball was exposed to a powerful pulse of energy.
ZKN_ALPHA_101_000	One of Electrode's characteristics is its attraction to electricity. It is a problematical Pokémon that congregates mostly at electrical power plants to feed on electricity that has just been generated.
ZKN_ALPHA_102_000	This Pokémon consists of six eggs that form a closely knit cluster. The six eggs attract each other and spin around. When cracks increasingly appear on the eggs, Exeggcute is close to evolution.
ZKN_ALPHA_103_000	Exeggutor originally came from the tropics. Its heads steadily grow larger from exposure to strong sunlight. It is said that when the heads fall off, they group together to form Exeggcute.
ZKN_ALPHA_104_000	Cubone pines for the mother it will never see again. Seeing a likeness of its mother in the full moon, it cries. The stains on the skull the Pokémon wears are made by the tears it sheds.

ZKN_ALPHA_106_000	Hitmonlee's legs freely contract and stretch. Using these springlike legs, it bowls over foes with devastating kicks. After battle, it rubs down its legs and loosens the muscles to overcome fatigue.
ZKN_ALPHA_107_000	Hitmonchan is said to possess the spirit of a boxer who had been working toward a world championship. This Pokémon has an indomitable spirit and will never give up in the face of adversity.
ZKN_ALPHA_108_000	Whenever Lickitung comes across something new, it will unfailingly give it a lick. It does so because it memorizes things by texture and by taste. It is somewhat put off by sour things.
ZKN_ALPHA_109_000	Koffing embodies toxic substances. It mixes the toxins with raw garbage to set off a chemical reaction that results in a terribly powerful poison gas. The higher the temperature, the more gas is concocted by this Pokémon.
ZKN_ALPHA_110_000	Weezing alternately shrinks and inflates its twin bodies to mix together toxic gases inside. The more the gases are mixed, the more powerful the toxins become. The Pokémon also becomes more putrid.
ZKN_ALPHA_111_000	Rhyhorn's brain is very small. It is so dense, while on a run it forgets why it started running in the first place. It apparently remembers sometimes if it demolishes something.
ZKN_ALPHA_112_000	Rhydon has a horn that serves as a drill. It is used for destroying rocks and boulders. This Pokémon occasionally rams into streams of magma, but the armor-like hide prevents it from feeling the heat.
ZKN_ALPHA_113_000	Chansey lays nutritionally excellent eggs on an everyday basis. The eggs are so delicious, they are easily and eagerly devoured by even those people who have lost their appetite.
ZKN_ALPHA_114_000	Tangela's vines snap off easily if they are grabbed. This happens without pain, allowing it to make a quick getaway. The lost vines are replaced by newly grown vines the very next day.
ZKN_ALPHA_115_000	If you come across a young Kangaskhan playing by itself, you must never disturb it or attempt to catch it. The baby Pokémon's parent is sure to be in the area, and it will become violently enraged at you.

ZKN_ALPHA_122_000	Mr. Mime is a master of pantomime. Its gestures and motions convince watchers that something unseeable actually exists. Once the watchers are convinced, the unseeable thing exists as if it were real.
ZKN_ALPHA_123_000	Scyther is blindingly fast. Its blazing speed enhances the effectiveness of the twin scythes on its forearms. This Pokémon's scythes are so effective, they can slice through thick logs in one wicked stroke.
ZKN_ALPHA_124_000	Jynx walks rhythmically, swaying and shaking its hips as if it were dancing. Its motions are so bouncingly alluring, people seeing it are compelled to shake their hips without giving any thought to what they are doing.

ZKN_ALPHA_129_000	Magikarp is virtually useless in battle as it can only splash around. As a result, it is considered to be weak. However, it is actually a very hardy Pokémon that can survive in any body of water no matter how polluted it is.
ZKN_ALPHA_130_000	Once Gyarados goes on a rampage, its ferociously violent blood doesn't calm until it has burned everything down. There are records of this Pokémon's rampages lasting a whole month.
ZKN_ALPHA_131_000	People have driven Lapras almost to the point of extinction. In the evenings, this Pokémon is said to sing plaintively as it seeks what few others of its kind still remain.

ZKN_ALPHA_134_000	Vaporeon underwent a spontaneous mutation and grew fins and gills that allow it to live underwater. This Pokémon has the ability to freely control water.
ZKN_ALPHA_135_000	Jolteon's cells generate a low level of electricity. This power is amplified by the static electricity of its fur, enabling the Pokémon to drop thunderbolts. The bristling fur is made of electrically charged needles.
ZKN_ALPHA_136_000	Flareon's fluffy fur has a functional purpose—it releases heat into the air so that its body does not get excessively hot. This Pokémon's body temperature can rise to a maximum of 1,650 degrees Fahrenheit.
ZKN_ALPHA_137_000	Porygon is capable of reverting itself entirely back to program data and entering cyberspace. This Pokémon is copy protected so it cannot be duplicated by copying.
ZKN_ALPHA_138_000	Omanyte is one of the ancient and long-since-extinct Pokémon that have been regenerated from fossils by people. If attacked by an enemy, it withdraws itself inside its hard shell.
ZKN_ALPHA_139_000	Omastar uses its tentacles to capture its prey. It is believed to have become extinct because its shell grew too large and heavy, causing its movements to become too slow and ponderous.
ZKN_ALPHA_140_000	Kabuto is a Pokémon that has been regenerated from a fossil. However, in extremely rare cases, living examples have been discovered. The Pokémon has not changed at all for 300 million years.
ZKN_ALPHA_141_000	Kabutops swam underwater to hunt for its prey in ancient times. The Pokémon was apparently evolving from being a water dweller to living on land as evident from the beginnings of change in its gills and legs.
ZKN_ALPHA_142_000	Aerodactyl is a Pokémon from the age of dinosaurs. It was regenerated from genetic material extracted from amber. It is imagined to have been the king of the skies in ancient times.
ZKN_ALPHA_143_000	Snorlax's typical day consists of nothing more than eating and sleeping. It is such a docile Pokémon that there are children who use its expansive belly as a place to play.
ZKN_ALPHA_144_000	Articuno is a legendary bird Pokémon that can control ice. The flapping of its wings chills the air. As a result, it is said that when this Pokémon flies, snow will fall.
ZKN_ALPHA_145_000	Zapdos is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control electricity. It usually lives in thunderclouds. The Pokémon gains power if it is stricken by lightning bolts.
ZKN_ALPHA_146_000	Moltres is a legendary bird Pokémon that has the ability to control fire. If this Pokémon is injured, it is said to dip its body in the molten magma of a volcano to burn and heal itself.
ZKN_ALPHA_147_000	Dratini continually molts and sloughs off its old skin. It does so because the life energy within its body steadily builds to reach uncontrollable levels.
ZKN_ALPHA_148_000	Dragonair stores an enormous amount of energy inside its body. It is said to alter weather conditions in its vicinity by discharging energy from the crystals on its neck and tail.
ZKN_ALPHA_149_000	Dragonite is capable of circling the globe in just 16 hours. It is a kindhearted Pokémon that leads lost and foundering ships in a storm to the safety of land.
ZKN_ALPHA_150_000	Mewtwo is a Pokémon that was created by genetic manipulation. However, even though the scientific power of humans created this Pokémon's body, they failed to endow Mewtwo with a compassionate heart.
ZKN_ALPHA_151_000	Mew is said to possess the genetic composition of all Pokémon. It is capable of making itself invisible at will, so it entirely avoids notice even if it approaches people.
ZKN_ALPHA_152_000	In battle, Chikorita waves its leaf around to keep the foe at bay. However, a sweet fragrance also wafts from the leaf, becalming the battling Pokémon and creating a cozy, friendly atmosphere all around.

ZKN_ALPHA_154_000	The fragrance of Meganium's flower soothes and calms emotions. In battle, this Pokémon gives off more of its becalming scent to blunt the foe's fighting spirit.
ZKN_ALPHA_155_000	Cyndaquil protects itself by flaring up the flames on its back. The flames are vigorous if the Pokémon is angry. However, if it is tired, the flames splutter fitfully with incomplete combustion.
ZKN_ALPHA_156_000	Quilava keeps its foes at bay with the intensity of its flames and gusts of superheated air. This Pokémon applies its outstanding nimbleness to dodge attacks even while scorching the foe with flames.
ZKN_ALPHA_157_000	Typhlosion obscures itself behind a shimmering heat haze that it creates using its intensely hot flames. This Pokémon creates blazing explosive blasts that burn everything to cinders.
ZKN_ALPHA_158_000	Despite the smallness of its body, Totodile's jaws are very powerful. While the Pokémon may think it is just playfully nipping, its bite has enough power to cause serious injury.
ZKN_ALPHA_159_000	Once Croconaw has clamped its jaws on its foe, it will absolutely not let go. Because the tips of its fangs are forked back like barbed fishhooks, they become impossible to remove when they have sunk in.
ZKN_ALPHA_160_000	Feraligatr intimidates its foes by opening its huge mouth. In battle, it will kick the ground hard with its thick and powerful hind legs to charge at the foe at an incredible speed.
ZKN_ALPHA_161_000	When Sentret sleeps, it does so while another stands guard. The sentry wakes the others at the first sign of danger. When this Pokémon becomes separated from its pack, it becomes incapable of sleep due to fear.
ZKN_ALPHA_162_000	Furret has a very slim build. When under attack, it can slickly squirm through narrow spaces and get away. In spite of its short limbs, this Pokémon is very nimble and fleet.
ZKN_ALPHA_163_000	Hoothoot has an internal organ that senses and tracks the earth's rotation. Using this special organ, this Pokémon begins hooting at precisely the same time every day.
ZKN_ALPHA_164_000	Noctowl never fails at catching prey in darkness. This Pokémon owes its success to its superior vision that allows it to see in minimal light, and to its soft, supple wings that make no sound in flight.
ZKN_ALPHA_165_000	Ledyba secretes an aromatic fluid from where its legs join its body. This fluid is used for communicating with others. This Pokémon conveys its feelings to others by altering the fluid's scent.
ZKN_ALPHA_166_000	It is said that in lands with clean air, where the stars fill the sky, there live Ledian in countless numbers. There is a good reason for this—the Pokémon uses the light of the stars as its energy.
ZKN_ALPHA_167_000	The web spun by Spinarak can be considered its second nervous system. It is said that this Pokémon can determine what kind of prey is touching its web just by the tiny vibrations it feels through the web's strands.
ZKN_ALPHA_168_000	Ariados's feet are tipped with tiny hooked claws that enable it to scuttle on ceilings and vertical walls. This Pokémon constricts the foe with thin and strong silk webbing.
ZKN_ALPHA_169_000	Crobat sneaks up on its intended prey using wings that barely make a sound. This Pokémon rests by hanging on a tree branch with its rear legs that serve as wings.
ZKN_ALPHA_170_000	Chinchou's two antennas are filled with cells that generate strong electricity. This Pokémon's cells create so much electrical power, it even makes itself tingle slightly.
ZKN_ALPHA_171_000	Lanturn is known to emit light. If you peer down into the dark sea from a ship at night, you can sometimes see this Pokémon's light rising from the depths where it swims. It gives the sea an appearance of a starlit night.
ZKN_ALPHA_172_000	When Pichu plays with others, it may short out electricity with another Pichu, creating a shower of sparks. In that event, this Pokémon will begin crying, startled by the flash of sparks.
ZKN_ALPHA_173_000	On nights with many shooting stars, Cleffa can be seen dancing in a ring. They dance through the night and stop only at the break of day, when these Pokémon quench their thirst with the morning dew.
ZKN_ALPHA_174_000	Igglybuff has a soft and plushy body that feels very much like a marshmallow. From this body wafts a gently sweet fragrance that soothes and calms the emotions of its foes.
ZKN_ALPHA_175_000	As its energy, Togepi uses the positive emotions of compassion and pleasure exuded by people and Pokémon. This Pokémon stores up feelings of happiness inside its shell, then shares them with others.
ZKN_ALPHA_176_000	Togetic is said to be a Pokémon that brings good fortune. When the Pokémon spots someone who is pure of heart, it is said to appear and share its happiness with that person.
ZKN_ALPHA_177_000	Natu has a highly developed jumping ability. The Pokémon flaps and leaps onto tree branches that are taller than grown-up people to pick at the tree's new shoots.
ZKN_ALPHA_178_000	Xatu is known to stand motionless while staring at the sun all day long. Some people revere it as a mystical Pokémon out of their belief that Xatu is in possession of the power to see into the future.
ZKN_ALPHA_179_000	Mareep's fluffy coat of wool rubs together and builds a static charge. The more static electricity is charged, the more brightly the lightbulb at the tip of its tail glows.
ZKN_ALPHA_180_000	Flaaffy's wool quality changes so that it can generate a high amount of static electricity with a small amount of wool. The bare and slick parts of its hide are shielded against electricity.
ZKN_ALPHA_181_000	Ampharos gives off so much light that it can be seen even from space. People in the old days used the light of this Pokémon to send signals back and forth with others far away.
ZKN_ALPHA_182_000	A Bellossom grows flowers more beautifully if it has evolved from a smelly Gloom—the more stinky the better. At night, this Pokémon closes its petals and goes to sleep.
ZKN_ALPHA_183_000	When fishing for food at the edge of a fast-running stream, Marill wraps its tail around the trunk of a tree. This Pokémon's tail is flexible and configured to stretch.
ZKN_ALPHA_184_000	Azumarill can make balloons out of air. It makes these air balloons if it spots a drowning Pokémon. The air balloons enable the Pokémon in trouble to breathe.
ZKN_ALPHA_185_000	Sudowoodo camouflages itself as a tree to avoid being attacked by enemies. However, because its hands remain green throughout the year, the Pokémon is easily identified as a fake during the winter.
ZKN_ALPHA_186_000	The curled hair on Politoed's head is proof of its status as a king. It is said that the longer and more curled the hair, the more respect this Pokémon earns from its peers.
ZKN_ALPHA_187_000	This Pokémon drifts and floats with the wind. If it senses the approach of strong winds, Hoppip links its leaves with other Hoppip to prepare against being blown away.
ZKN_ALPHA_188_000	Skiploom's flower blossoms when the temperature rises above 64 degrees Fahrenheit. How much the flower opens depends on the temperature. For that reason, this Pokémon is sometimes used as a thermometer.
ZKN_ALPHA_189_000	Jumpluff rides warm southern winds to cross the sea and fly to foreign lands. The Pokémon descends to the ground when it encounters cold air while it is floating.
ZKN_ALPHA_190_000	Aipom's tail ends in a hand-like appendage that can be cleverly manipulated. However, because the Pokémon uses its tail so much, its real hands have become rather clumsy.
ZKN_ALPHA_191_000	Sunkern tries to move as little as it possibly can. It does so because it tries to conserve all the nutrients it has stored in its body for its evolution. It will not eat a thing, subsisting only on morning dew.
ZKN_ALPHA_192_000	Sunflora converts solar energy into nutrition. It moves around actively in the daytime when it is warm. It stops moving as soon as the sun goes down for the night.
ZKN_ALPHA_193_000	Yanma is capable of seeing 360 degrees without having to move its eyes. It is a great flier that is adept at making sudden stops and turning midair. This Pokémon uses its flying ability to quickly chase down targeted prey.
ZKN_ALPHA_194_000	Wooper usually lives in water. However, it occasionally comes out onto land in search of food. On land, it coats its body with a gooey, toxic film.
ZKN_ALPHA_195_000	Quagsire hunts for food by leaving its mouth wide open in water and waiting for its prey to blunder in unaware. Because the Pokémon does not move, it does not get very hungry.
ZKN_ALPHA_196_000	Espeon is extremely loyal to any Trainer it considers to be worthy. It is said that this Pokémon developed its precognitive powers to protect its Trainer from harm.
ZKN_ALPHA_197_000	Umbreon evolved as a result of exposure to the moon's waves. It hides silently in darkness and waits for its foes to make a move. The rings on its body glow when it leaps to attack.
ZKN_ALPHA_198_000	Murkrow was feared and loathed as the alleged bearer of ill fortune. This Pokémon shows strong interest in anything that sparkles or glitters. It will even try to steal rings from women.
ZKN_ALPHA_199_000	Slowking undertakes research every day in an effort to solve the mysteries of the world. However, this Pokémon apparently forgets everything it has learned if the Shellder on its head comes off.
ZKN_ALPHA_200_000	Misdreavus frightens people with a creepy, sobbing cry. The Pokémon apparently uses its red spheres to absorb the fearful feelings of foes and turn them into nutrition.
ZKN_ALPHA_201_000	This Pokémon is shaped like ancient writing. It is a mystery as to which came first, the ancient writings or the various Unown. Research into this topic is ongoing but nothing is known.
ZKN_ALPHA_202_000	Wobbuffet does nothing but endure attacks—it won't attack on its own. However, it won't endure an attack on its tail. When that happens, the Pokémon will try to take the foe with it using Destiny Bond.
ZKN_ALPHA_203_000	Girafarig's rear head contains a tiny brain that is too small for thinking. However, the rear head doesn't need to sleep, so it can keep watch over its surroundings 24 hours a day.
ZKN_ALPHA_204_000	Pineco hangs from a tree branch and patiently waits for prey to come along. If the Pokémon is disturbed while eating by someone shaking its tree, it drops down to the ground and explodes with no warning.
ZKN_ALPHA_205_000	Forretress conceals itself inside its hardened steel shell. The shell is opened when the Pokémon is catching prey, but it does so at such a quick pace that the shell's inside cannot be seen.
ZKN_ALPHA_206_000	Dunsparce has a drill for its tail. It uses this tail to burrow into the ground backward. This Pokémon is known to make its nest in complex shapes deep under the ground.
ZKN_ALPHA_207_000	Gligar glides through the air without a sound as if it were sliding. This Pokémon hangs on to the face of its foe using its clawed hind legs and the large pincers on its forelegs, then injects the prey with its poison barb.
ZKN_ALPHA_208_000	Steelix lives even further underground than Onix. This Pokémon is known to dig toward the earth's core. There are records of this Pokémon reaching a depth of over six-tenths of a mile underground.
ZKN_ALPHA_209_000	By baring its fangs and making a scary face, Snubbull sends smaller Pokémon scurrying away in terror. However, this Pokémon seems a little sad at making its foes flee.
ZKN_ALPHA_210_000	Granbull has a particularly well-developed lower jaw. The enormous fangs are heavy, causing the Pokémon to tip its head back for balance. Unless it is startled, it will not try to bite indiscriminately.
ZKN_ALPHA_211_000	Qwilfish sucks in water, inflating itself. This Pokémon uses the pressure of the water it swallowed to shoot toxic quills all at once from all over its body. It finds swimming somewhat challenging.
ZKN_ALPHA_212_000	Scizor has a body with the hardness of steel. It is not easily fazed by ordinary sorts of attacks. This Pokémon flaps its wings to regulate its body temperature.
ZKN_ALPHA_213_000	Shuckle quietly hides itself under rocks, keeping its body concealed inside its hard shell while eating berries it has stored away. The berries mix with its body fluids to become a juice.
ZKN_ALPHA_214_000	Heracross has sharp claws on its feet. These are planted firmly into the ground or the bark of a tree, giving the Pokémon a secure and solid footing to forcefully fling away foes with its proud horn.
ZKN_ALPHA_215_000	Sneasel scales trees by punching its hooked claws into the bark. This Pokémon seeks out unguarded nests and steals eggs for food while the parents are away.
ZKN_ALPHA_216_000	This Pokémon likes to lick its palms that are sweetened by being soaked in honey. Teddiursa concocts its own honey by blending fruits and pollen collected by Beedrill.
ZKN_ALPHA_217_000	In the forests inhabited by Ursaring, it is said that there are many streams and towering trees where they gather food. This Pokémon walks through its forest gathering food every day.
ZKN_ALPHA_218_000	Slugma does not have any blood in its body. Instead, intensely hot magma circulates throughout this Pokémon's body, carrying essential nutrients and oxygen to its organs.
ZKN_ALPHA_219_000	Magcargo's body temperature is approximately 18,000 degrees Fahrenheit. Water is vaporized on contact. If this Pokémon is caught in the rain, the raindrops instantly turn into steam, cloaking the area in a thick fog.
ZKN_ALPHA_220_000	Swinub roots for food by rubbing its snout against the ground. Its favorite food is a mushroom that grows under the cover of dead grass. This Pokémon occasionally roots out hot springs.
ZKN_ALPHA_221_000	Piloswine is covered by a thick coat of long hair that enables it to endure the freezing cold. This Pokémon uses its tusks to dig up food that has been buried under ice.
ZKN_ALPHA_222_000	Clusters of Corsola congregate in warm seas where they serve as ideal hiding places for smaller Pokémon. When the water temperature falls, this Pokémon migrates to the southern seas.
ZKN_ALPHA_223_000	Remoraid sucks in water, then expels it at high velocity using its abdominal muscles to shoot down flying prey. When evolution draws near, this Pokémon travels downstream from rivers.
ZKN_ALPHA_224_000	Octillery grabs onto its foe using its tentacles. This Pokémon tries to immobilize it before delivering the finishing blow. If the foe turns out to be too strong, Octillery spews ink to escape.
ZKN_ALPHA_225_000	Delibird carries its food bundled up in its tail. There once was a famous explorer who managed to reach the peak of the world's highest mountain, thanks to one of these Pokémon sharing its food.
ZKN_ALPHA_226_000	On sunny days, schools of Mantine can be seen elegantly leaping over the sea's waves. This Pokémon is not bothered by the Remoraid that hitches rides.
ZKN_ALPHA_227_000	Skarmory's steel wings become tattered and bashed in from repeated battles. Once a year, the battered wings grow back completely, restoring the cutting edges to their pristine state.
ZKN_ALPHA_228_000	Houndour hunt as a coordinated pack. They communicate with each other using a variety of cries to corner their prey. This Pokémon's remarkable teamwork is unparalleled.
ZKN_ALPHA_229_000	In a Houndoom pack, the one with its horns raked sharply toward the back serves a leadership role. These Pokémon choose their leader by fighting among themselves.
ZKN_ALPHA_230_000	Kingdra sleeps on the seafloor where it is otherwise devoid of life. When a storm arrives, the Pokémon is said to awaken and wander about in search of prey.
ZKN_ALPHA_231_000	Phanpy uses its long nose to shower itself. When others gather around, they thoroughly douse each other with water. These Pokémon can be seen drying their soaking-wet bodies at the edge of water.
ZKN_ALPHA_232_000	If Donphan were to tackle with its hard body, even a house could be destroyed. Using its massive strength, the Pokémon helps clear rock and mud slides that block mountain trails.

ZKN_ALPHA_234_000	Stantler's magnificent antlers were traded at high prices as works of art. As a result, this Pokémon was hunted close to extinction by those who were after the priceless antlers.

ZKN_ALPHA_236_000	Tyrogue becomes stressed out if it does not get to train every day. When raising this Pokémon, the Trainer must establish and uphold various training methods.
ZKN_ALPHA_237_000	Hitmontop spins on its head at high speed, all the while delivering kicks. This technique is a remarkable mix of both offense and defense at the same time. The Pokémon travels faster spinning than it does walking.

ZKN_ALPHA_239_000	Elekid stores electricity in its body. If it touches metal and accidentally discharges all its built-up electricity, this Pokémon begins swinging its arms in circles to recharge itself.
ZKN_ALPHA_240_000	Magby's state of health is determined by observing the fire it breathes. If the Pokémon is spouting yellow flames from its mouth, it is in good health. When it is fatigued, black smoke will be mixed in with the flames.

ZKN_ALPHA_245_000	Suicune embodies the compassion of a pure spring of water. It runs across the land with gracefulness. This Pokémon has the power to purify dirty water.

ZKN_ALPHA_252_000	Treecko is cool, calm, and collected—it never panics under any situation. If a bigger foe were to glare at this Pokémon, it would glare right back without conceding an inch of ground.

ZKN_ALPHA_309_000	Electrike runs faster than the human eye can follow. The friction from running is converted into electricity, which is then stored in this Pokémon's fur.

ZKN_ALPHA_317_000	Swalot has no teeth, so what it eats, it swallows whole, no matter what. Its cavernous mouth yawns widely. An automobile tire could easily fit inside this Pokémon's mouth.

ZKN_ALPHA_324_000	Torkoal generates energy by burning coal. It grows weaker as the fire dies down. When it is preparing for battle, this Pokémon burns more coal.

ZKN_ALPHA_327_000	No two Spinda are said to have identical spot patterns on their hides. This Pokémon moves in a curious manner as if it is stumbling in dizziness. Its lurching movements can cause the opponent to become confused.
ZKN_ALPHA_328_000	Trapinch is a patient hunter. It digs an inescapable pit in a desert and waits for its prey to come tumbling down. This Pokémon can go a whole week without access to any water.
ZKN_ALPHA_329_000	Vibrava's wings have not yet completed the process of growing. Rather than flying long distances, they are more useful for generating ultrasonic waves by vibrating.
ZKN_ALPHA_330_000	Flygon whips up a sandstorm by flapping its wings. The wings create a series of notes that sound like singing. Because the "singing" is the only thing that can be heard in a sandstorm, this Pokémon is said to be the desert spirit.

ZKN_ARCEUS_414_000	Scatters steel-colored scales as it flaps its wings. Despite being observed feeding primarily on the nectar of flowers, Mothim is not often seen around flower gardens.
ZKN_ARCEUS_415_000	They swear fealty to a queen Pokémon and work diligently to gather nectar. Each swarm produces a different flavor of honey.
ZKN_ARCEUS_416_000	Commands its subjects to build its hive. It will dispatch any interlopers who dare sneak into its nest and use them as nourishment for itself.
ZKN_ARCEUS_417_000	A species related to the Pikachu line. Though Pachirisu is a calm Pokémon, it still presents a danger should one touch its electrified tail or cheeks.
ZKN_ARCEUS_418_000	It moves freely in the water by spinning its forked tail for propulsion. The resemblance to the screw of a steamboat is coincidental.
ZKN_ARCEUS_419_000	Has a long, rather splendid flotation sac, which prevents Floatzel from drowning even in stormy seas. One might glimpse this species around fishing hamlets from time to time.
ZKN_ARCEUS_420_000	Once the fruit growing alongside the main body is large and plump, Cherubi will use the nutrients within to evolve. The fruit then detaches, becoming nourishment for other creatures.
ZKN_ARCEUS_421_000	Motionless, save for the occasional quiver. A rich array of Pokémon can be found gathered around it, drawn by the scent exuded from Cherrim's folded petals.
ZKN_ARCEUS_422_000	Found in abundance on seashores bordering warm waters. Shellos are unexpectedly friendly and will crawl toward any person they see. Take care not to get coated in mucus!
ZKN_ARCEUS_423_000	Eats beach sand for nourishment. Should one Gastrodon encounter another of a different color, a fierce battle will inevitably ensue.
ZKN_ARCEUS_424_000	To affirm their kinship, members of this species will form a ring by linking their newly doubled tails together. On rare occasions, humans have been accepted into such rings.
ZKN_ARCEUS_425_000	Said to lure away young children and carry them off to the afterlife. Some whisper that Drifloon are formed of reincarnated human souls, but these rumors are as yet unconfirmed.
ZKN_ARCEUS_426_000	It drifts along at dusk, perfectly silent. Its transient, melancholy aspect touches some people deeply—every so often, one will come upon a song or poem devoted to Drifblim.
ZKN_ARCEUS_427_000	My hypothesis as to why Buneary rolls up its ears is that its hearing is far too keen. I surmise that the Pokémon protects its hearing by limiting the sound that may enter its ears.
ZKN_ARCEUS_428_000	Its fur is warm and yet remarkably light. This Pokémon kicks as though it were a master of karate, driving back its opponents with ease.
ZKN_ARCEUS_429_000	The incantations Mismagius chants can ward against misfortune, so a custom exists of inviting it into one's home. Incur the Pokémon's displeasure, however, and disaster will surely ensue.
ZKN_ARCEUS_430_000	One cry from this Pokémon, and a murder of Murkrow come flying. At such times, one would think the curtain of night had fallen, plunging the world into jet-black darkness.
ZKN_ARCEUS_431_000	Bewitches humans with its helical tail and piercing gaze. Its hidden claws are quite sharp as well, making this Pokémon an exceedingly tricky opponent if antagonized.
ZKN_ARCEUS_432_000	Though impudent and difficult to tame, Purugly enjoys great popularity due to its fur, the beauty of which surpasses even velveteen.
ZKN_ARCEUS_433_000	This Pokémon gave me an excruciating headache when it seemingly cried out without making a sound. Perhaps there are some sounds that the human ear is simply incapable of hearing.
ZKN_ARCEUS_434_000	The poison that gushes from its aft end is accompanied by an utterly evil-smelling odor with such potency that one whiff can induce memory loss.
ZKN_ARCEUS_435_000	Sprays a poisonous fluid to take down prey. Sometimes, unable to stomach the stench of its own fluid, it leaves the bested prey uneaten.
ZKN_ARCEUS_436_000	Floats using a mysterious energy. The pattern engraved upon its back is held as sacred and can sometimes be found in imagery from ancient cemeteries and other such timeworn places.
ZKN_ARCEUS_437_000	Some believe that its bell-like cry opens holes to another world. It has been revered as a deity since ancient times.
ZKN_ARCEUS_438_000	Its tears elicit sympathy from those who see them, but do not be deceived! This expulsion of body water is merely a physiological mechanism for keeping itself in good health.
ZKN_ARCEUS_439_000	Known to turn up in bustling marketplaces now and again. It mimics people much as a child would, then watches how they react, eyes sparkling.
ZKN_ARCEUS_440_000	In imitation of Chansey, it keeps a round stone tucked into its belly pouch and cherishes it dearly. It gets along well with children and will sometimes play house with them for fun.
ZKN_ARCEUS_441_000	A versatile performer skilled in the imitation of human speech. It is said that older, more experienced Chatot can even understand the meaning of the words they mimic.
ZKN_ARCEUS_442_000	It lays curses by thinking wicked thoughts. Writings tell that this Pokémon was born out of the assembly of five score and eight malevolent spirits.
ZKN_ARCEUS_443_000	It nests in caves untouched by sunlight. Its sharp teeth may fall out when worn away or after an impact, but they regrow within a few days.
ZKN_ARCEUS_444_000	Though Gabite are usually of a violent disposition, when I gave one a glass bead it had been eyeing covetously, it suddenly became quite docile.
ZKN_ARCEUS_445_000	Soars across the heavens at blinding speed—a magnificent sight! It has a feral disposition. Utmost caution is required if one meets a Garchomp out in the wilds.
ZKN_ARCEUS_446_000	Its robust stomach allows it to nonchalantly devour even rotted matter. It pays frequent visits to villages, seeking out food scraps intended for compost.
ZKN_ARCEUS_447_000	Though infantile in appearance, it has the mysterious ability to read the minds of humans. The pure of heart are met with Riolu's approval, while those of ill nature earn only its loathing.
ZKN_ARCEUS_448_000	A most gallant-looking creature. It emits energy waves and controls them with precision, using them to sense even faraway beings. I have given the name "aura" to this power.
ZKN_ARCEUS_449_000	Though large and languid, Hippopotas is difficult to detect due to its tendency to burrow into and lurk beneath the soil. When agitated or excited, it expels sand from its nostrils.
ZKN_ARCEUS_450_000	Short-tempered and easily moved to violence. It whips up whirlwinds of sand to crush its foes' spirits, then goes in for the attack.
ZKN_ARCEUS_451_000	Its claws are not only razor-sharp but poisonous, making Skorupi a highly dangerous Pokémon. It seems to be weakened by cold temperatures, however.
ZKN_ARCEUS_452_000	Has a brutish, ferocious temperament. With immense strength and a sturdy shell off which swords will bounce, it rampages about and wreaks havoc.
ZKN_ARCEUS_453_000	A poison wielder with a dastardly personality. Despite such qualities, this species is afforded a measure of popularity due to its peculiar cry and comical features.
ZKN_ARCEUS_454_000	Its crimson claws contain a virulent toxin. This toxin can be made into a tonic by diluting it, mixing it with several types of wild grass, and boiling it down over two days.
ZKN_ARCEUS_455_000	Though this is a plant Pokémon, it has a gluttonous and unruly temperament. Carnivine attacks its prey with its cavernous maw wide open.
ZKN_ARCEUS_456_000	What a gorgeous sight this Pokémon is as it swims with its long, pink-painted caudal fins fluttering behind it. Finneon's beautiful appearance has led to its nickname: "finery fish."
ZKN_ARCEUS_457_000	Uses its gleaming fins to hunt its prey. The view of Lumineon schooling near the surface of the sea at night is breathtaking— it's as though there were shining stars right there.
ZKN_ARCEUS_458_000	Though ball-like in shape, this Pokémon is a proficient swimmer. I have discovered that if a Mantyke spends much time with schools of Remoraid, it will eventually achieve evolution.
ZKN_ARCEUS_459_000	One is likely to encounter this Pokémon while out in the snow. There are stories of Snover appearing in human settlements but doing no harm—rather, they bond with the children.
ZKN_ARCEUS_460_000	A powerful Pokémon that can split huge boulders with ease. Dislikes associating with others and chooses to live quietly deep within the mountains, playing with the snow.
ZKN_ARCEUS_461_000	This species corners prey as a pack, under the guidance of a leader. Weavile displays increased cunning, leading me to speculate that its evolution caused further brain development.
ZKN_ARCEUS_462_000	I theorize that a special magnetic field influenced this Pokémon, changing its molecular structure and causing it to evolve. It emits strange radio waves toward space from its antenna.
ZKN_ARCEUS_463_000	Its tongue can extend and contract freely, and it is capable of reaching lengths over 10 times Lickilicky's height. Beware of the saliva, as it contains corrosive elements.
ZKN_ARCEUS_464_000	This Pokémon evolved through use of a curious item. Its rocklike hide is composed of a mysterious substance and can withstand a blow from a masterwork sword with nary a scratch.
ZKN_ARCEUS_465_000	Draped with long vines, it resembles a shrub in appearance. It swings bundles of vines as though they were arms, wrapping them around prey to ensnare them.
ZKN_ARCEUS_466_000	Its evolution was induced by an unusual item, and its electrical output rises along with its heart rate. From its tails, it can unleash an electric current measuring 20,000 volts.
ZKN_ARCEUS_467_000	Use of a strange item caused this Pokémon to evolve. Fireballs launched from the ends of its tubelike arms are hot enough to melt an iron pot in an instant.
ZKN_ARCEUS_468_000	Scant few have ever sighted this Pokémon. After studying what literature remains, I am certain Togekiss will reveal itself when peace reigns in the land.
ZKN_ARCEUS_469_000	Extremely violent. When hunting, it wastes none of its energy, aiming only for prey's most vulnerable spots. Any who manage to tame this Pokémon must be of incredible bravery.
ZKN_ARCEUS_470_000	Cells similar to those of plants have been found in its fur. Its hard tail can fell a large tree with one stroke, and the tail's sharpness exceeds even that of a sword crafted by a master.
ZKN_ARCEUS_471_000	Glaceon is able to lower its body temperature very quickly. It freezes the atmosphere, creating diamond dust that glitters like gems while it flutters and dances around.
ZKN_ARCEUS_472_000	It glides soundlessly on pitch-black wings and sinks sharp fangs into the throat of its prey. It takes on a look of satisfaction once it has entirely drained its prey of blood.
ZKN_ARCEUS_473_000	This species reached its zenith during the period known as the ice age. I suspect that Hisui's frigid climate is in harmony with Mamoswine's constitution, thus awakening hidden potential.
ZKN_ARCEUS_474_000	A curious item induced this evolution. The Pokémon's offensive capabilities have greatly increased, but the strangeness of its behavior has magnified in equal measure. This worries me.
ZKN_ARCEUS_475_000	The blades extending from its elbows are sharper than the finest swords. Its swordsmanship, albeit self-taught, is astonishingly impressive.
ZKN_ARCEUS_476_000	It is able to emit powerful magnetism, allowing it control over the iron sand that forms its luscious mustache. Using this iron sand, Probopass forms hard stones with which it smites its prey.

ZKN_ARCEUS_485_000	Stories tell of this Pokémon being birthed from the boiling magma within Mount Coronet. Its molten-steel body holds many mysteries.

ZKN_ARCEUS_488_000	Cresselia is reminiscent of the crescent moon. It leaves a brilliant line of light in its wake as it flies across the night sky. I daresay it resembles the heavenly maiden who created the Milky Way.
ZKN_ARCEUS_489_000	Can be seen floating offshore during seasons when the seas are warm. Its azure body blends in with the ocean waters—logic suggests this is a defense mechanism against natural predators.

ZKN_DIAMOND_000_000	
ZKN_DIAMOND_001_000	For some time after its birth, it grows by taking nourishment from the seed on its back.
ZKN_DIAMOND_002_000	When the bud on its back starts swelling, a sweet aroma wafts to indicate the flower's coming bloom.
ZKN_DIAMOND_003_000	After a rainy day, the flower on its back smells stronger. The scent attracts other Pokémon.
ZKN_DIAMOND_004_000	The fire on the tip of its tail is a measure of its life. If the Pokémon is healthy, its tail burns intensely.
ZKN_DIAMOND_005_000	In the rocky mountains where Charmeleon live, their fiery tails shine at night like stars.
ZKN_DIAMOND_006_000	It is said that Charizard’s fire burns hotter if it has experienced harsh battles.
ZKN_DIAMOND_007_000	It hides in its shell to protect itself, then strikes back with spouts of water at every opportunity.
ZKN_DIAMOND_008_000	It is said to live 10,000 years. Its furry tail is popular as a symbol of longevity.
ZKN_DIAMOND_009_000	The jets of water it spouts from the rocket cannons on its shell can punch through thick steel.
ZKN_DIAMOND_010_000	It releases a stench from its red antennae to repel enemies. It grows by molting repeatedly.
ZKN_DIAMOND_011_000	A steel-hard shell protects its tender body. The Pokémon quietly endures hardships while awaiting evolution.
ZKN_DIAMOND_012_000	It loves the nectar of flowers and can locate flower patches that have even tiny amounts of pollen.
ZKN_DIAMOND_013_000	It eats its weight in leaves every day. It fends off attackers with the needle on its head.
ZKN_DIAMOND_014_000	While awaiting evolution, it hides from predators under leaves and in nooks of branches.
ZKN_DIAMOND_015_000	Its best attack involves flying around at high speed, striking with poison needles, then flying off.
ZKN_DIAMOND_016_000	It is docile and prefers to avoid conflict. If disturbed, however, it can ferociously strike back.

ZKN_LETSGO_000_000	
ZKN_LETSGO_001_000	It can go for days without eating a single morsel. In the bulb on its back, it stores energy.
ZKN_LETSGO_002_000	The bud on its back grows by drawing energy. It gives off an aroma when it is ready to bloom.
ZKN_LETSGO_003_000	The flower on its back catches the sun's rays. The sunlight is then absorbed and used for energy.
ZKN_LETSGO_004_000	The flame at the tip of its tail makes a sound as it burns. You can only hear it in quiet places.
ZKN_LETSGO_005_000	Tough fights could excite this Pokémon. When excited, it may breathe out bluish-white flames.
ZKN_LETSGO_006_000	When this Pokémon expels a blast of superhot fire, the red flame at the tip of its tail burns more intensely.
ZKN_LETSGO_007_000	Shoots water at prey while in the water. Withdraws into its shell when in danger.
ZKN_LETSGO_008_000	When tapped on its head, this Pokémon will pull it in, but its tail will still stick out a little bit.
ZKN_LETSGO_009_000	Once it takes aim at its enemy, it blasts out water with even more force than a fire hose.
ZKN_LETSGO_010_000	If you touch the feeler on top of its head, it will release a horrible stink to protect itself.
ZKN_LETSGO_011_000	Hardens its shell to protect itself. However, a large impact may cause it to pop out of its shell.
ZKN_LETSGO_012_000	Its wings, covered with poisonous powder, repel water. This allows it to fly in the rain.
ZKN_LETSGO_013_000	Beware of the sharp stinger on its head. It hides in grass and bushes where it eats leaves.
ZKN_LETSGO_014_000	Able to move only slightly. When endangered, it may stick out its stinger and poison its enemy.
ZKN_LETSGO_015_000	It has three poisonous stingers on its forelegs and its tail. They are used to jab its enemy repeatedly.
ZKN_LETSGO_016_000	Very docile. If attacked, it will often kick up sand to protect itself rather than fight back.
ZKN_LETSGO_017_000	This Pokémon is full of vitality. It constantly flies around its large territory in search of prey.
ZKN_LETSGO_018_000	This Pokémon flies at Mach 2 speed, seeking prey. Its large talons are feared as wicked weapons.
ZKN_LETSGO_019_000	Will chew on anything with its fangs. If you see one, you can be certain that 40 more live in the area.
ZKN_LETSGO_020_000	Its hind feet are webbed. They act as flippers, so it can swim in rivers and hunt for prey.
ZKN_LETSGO_021_000	Inept at flying high. However, it can fly around very fast to protect its territory.
ZKN_LETSGO_022_000	A Pokémon that dates back many years. If it senses danger, it flies high and away, instantly.

ZKN_LETSGO_036_000	They appear to be very protective of their own world. It is a kind of fairy, rarely seen by people.
